Comment: The business importing the product would be required to pay 104% import tax on not just the value of the item, but also any added cost to ship it here, which is minimal.  However, the math doesn't bode well for profits that way. So, they would be forced to raise the retail price much higher to cover both the cost of making the product, shipping it, and the import tax, and still leave something left for profit.  In the case of China, if we consider they used slave labor for production, plus shipping, perhaps their total cost to produce and ship is $3 per item.  Cost of goods and shipping of $3 plus $10.40 import tax (based on a taxed value of $10.00) brings their total cost to $13.40. Now they have to raise the retail price high enough to cover that much higher cost to import here, and still make a decent profit. If they were previously paying a 20% import tax ($2.00) their profit was around $5.00. In order to maintain that same profit margin, they would need to raise the retail price up to ~$18.40 ($3.00 + $10.40 + $5.00)  This is why you hear people saying the customer ends up paying for the tariffs. In this case, your cost increased by ~80%. While you have the added expense of paying taxes to pay for tRumps taxpayer funded golf trips every few days, of approx $3 Million each and his upcoming ego trip military parade.
